headline: AppLovin (NASDAQ:APP) Misses Q2 Sales Targets
summary: Mobile app advertising platform AppLovin (NASDAQ: APP) missed Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q2 CY2025, but sales rose 16.5% year on year to $1.26 billion. On the other hand, next quarter’s outlook exceeded expectations with revenue guided to $1.33 billion at the midpoint, or 1.3% above analysts’ estimates. Its GAAP profit of $2.39 per share was 20.4% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

Its GAAP profit of $2.39 per share was 20.4% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: AppLovin Reports Solid Earnings. The Stock Is Down.
summary: AppLovin sold its gaming app segment to focus on its rapidly expanding advertising technology business.

headline: AppLovin Posts Beat-And-Raise Report. But Investors Aren't Lovin' It.
summary: AppLovin beat Wall Street's targets for the second quarter and guided higher for sales in the current period. Still, AppLovin stock fell.

headline: Applovin, DraftKings, E.l.f. Beauty: After-hours trending stocks
summary: Applovin (APP) beat second quarter earnings and adjusted EBITDA estimates. DraftKings (DKNG) exceeded second quarter revenue and EBITDA estimates. E.l.f. Beauty (ELF) beat earnings but saw gross margin decline from tariffs. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend.

headline: AppLovin Logs Higher Profit, Sales in Second Quarter
summary: The tech company’s revenue jumped 77% to $1.26 billion, topping analyst estimates for $1.22 billion.

headline: AppLovin: Q2 Earnings Snapshot
summary: The average estimate of six analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of $1.99 per share. The mobile app technology company posted revenue of $1.26 billion in the period, also topping Street forecasts. Seven analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $1.21 billion.

headline: AppLovin Announces Second Quarter 2025 Financial Results
summary: PALO ALTO, Calif., August 06, 2025--AppLovin Corporation (NASDAQ: APP) ("AppLovin"), a leading marketing platform, today announced financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025 and posted a financial update on its Investor Relations website located at https://investors.applovin.com.

headline: Why the S&P 500 May Get a New Member Soon
summary: Paramount Global could be on the chopping block if the S&P 500’s managers decide its impending merger with Skydance Media makes it too small for the benchmark large-cap index.
